themes: Desire for locally-focused outdoor arts events
Critique of large commercial festivals (ACL) in public spaces
Need for educational and career development opportunities in the arts
Call for diversity in music and performance genres
Accessibility and affordability of cultural events
Overemphasis on certain venues and genres
key_phrases: OUTDOOR plays and events that are FOR Austin and BY Austin
NOT like ACL which should get the hell out of Zilker already
learning opportunities (camps/classes) for filmmakers, playwrights, actors, writers, sound engineers, lighting engineers and all of the supporting arts
assistance and learning on the business side of managing a career in the arts
spend just one year promoting arts outside of Antone's and the Continental Club
the kids don't even like rock n roll
let's try a few new channels
outdoor, free, FREE, FREE, but not on the ACL model
Do it on the Zilker Hillside Model and you get my vote
barriers_identified: Dominance of large commercial festivals (ACL) in public spaces
Lack of support and visibility for non-mainstream genres and venues
Insufficient educational and business resources for artists
Overemphasis on rock n roll and specific venues
solutions_proposed: Remove or relocate ACL from Zilker Park
Provide learning opportunities (camps/classes) for a broad range of arts roles
Promote arts outside of well-known venues like Antone's and the Continental Club
Diversify music and performance offerings (e.g., classical music, dixieland jazz)
Adopt the Zilker Hillside Model for free, accessible events
